title: Towneley Hall Park Walking Route

images.title: Towneley Hall, Fountain by Alexander P Kapp, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Towneley Hall, Fountain

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Towneley Hall, Burnley
images.caption: Towneley Hall. The hall was the home of the Towneley family from around 1200. The family once owned extensive estates in and around Lancashire and the West Riding of Yorkshire.

images.title: robert wade / Cafe at Towneley Hall
images.caption: Cafe. This was formerly the stable block for the hall. It is a grade I listed building. The hall contains the 15th-century Whalley Abbey vestments and also has its own chapel – with a finely carved altarpiece made in Antwerp around 1525.

images.title: Alexander P Kapp / Towneley Hall War Memorial
images.caption: War Memorial

images.title: Bridge over the River Calder by Bill Boaden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bridge over the River Calder on the eastern side of the park.

images.title: robert wade / The Old Brew House, Towneley Hall
images.caption: The Old Brew House, Townley Hall. This is now the museum of Burnley life.

description: Explore the 440 acres of parkland surrounding Towneley Hall in Burnley, Lancashire. In the park you will find woodland, the River Calder and the Deer Pond which is designated as a Local Nature Reserve. The hall itself contains period rooms, an art gallery and a museum with displays including: Natural History, Egyptology, Local History, Textiles, Decorative Art and Regional Furniture. If you would like to continue your walk you could follow the Burnley Way Walk which runs through the park.
display_address: Todmorden Road, Pike Hill, Rose Hill, Walk Mill, Burnley, Lancashire, England, BB11 3QT, United Kingdom
